reviews.title: Tight Fit
reviews.review_text: I recently received the Free Country Women's Bermuda Board Short II Pink Orchid. I ordered the XL using the size chart. Most size charts that give more than one number size for the letter size will fit that range. Not these. XL on all the tags but the sewn in tab states it is a size 16 whereas the size chart states an XL is 16 and 18. I prefer my bottoms to have some room. These shorts are fitted so every curve shows. At a 16, these fit but have no room. Anything added to the pockets would make an undesirable bulge. I will be taking them on vacation but do not have confidence that I will experience much comfort trying to put them on if I am wet. Even with 7% Spandex, there is not much give. It really is a shame that the fit is so off as these are super cute and well made.

reviews.title: The Paint Never Cured!
reviews.review_text: I bought the Glidden Spred Grab-N-Go interior latex paint, semi-gloss finish in the color Farm from Walmart on April 21, 2025. We painted our bathroom with it a few days later. The walls were originally painted with flat white paint as a primer, and my husband made a few repairs to the sheet rock with drywall joint compound in a few places before we painted, so some surfaces were bare finished sheet rock and some were previously painted. I've been painting walls in houses for the past 40 years, and I've never had a paint do this. After the paint had dried to the touch, we removed the painter's masking tape. On one wall near the shower, the paint peeled off with the tape as if it were a stretchy sheet of latex. I thought maybe the wall there didn't get prepped as well as it should, so I removed the paint, sanded the wall, wiped the dust off, and painted it again. There were a few other places where the paint still felt gummy, so we put fans in the room and waited a few more days before attempting to remove the rest of the masking tape. After that, the tape mostly came off without damaging the paint, and I touched up the few places that peeled. The paint still felt kind of soft, so we decided to wait a few days more before we started to put trim and the mirror back up. After almost 2 weeks, the paint still felt soft, so I contacted Walmart to request a refund. I also called Glidden to report my issue and ask for advice as to how to get the paint to cure. The representative suggested that we get plenty of air flow into the room, which we had already done. My husband had the idea to put a space heater in there and close the door, and the representative agreed that was worth a try. He had no other suggestions except that if it didn't cure, I would most likely have to remove the paint and start over. 😕 Our best guess is that the paint was frozen in shipping somewhere before it got to the store since the manufacture date on the can is February. It's now been almost a month, and the paint has stayed soft. Any little bump against the wall makes a nick in the paint, including just brushing against it lightly with a fingernail. Today, I decided to remove some of the paint at those nicked places, and the paint just peels away like dead skin. It's going to take hours to remove all the paint from the walls. I'm not sure I trust this product enough to buy another one and repaint or if I'm just going to wallpaper the whole room. This is very frustrating. I would like to add that the color and coverage of this paint were great. Applying the paint was easy. But none of that matters if the paint never dries. Another note. We did purchase a second gallon of this exact paint except in the color white. We painted our doors and trim with it, and it cured just fine. https://youtube.com/shorts/TjJZBwVIgo4?si=AEUGKTJa_irRHDvP

reviews.title: Product YAY, Service NAY
reviews.review_text: They have either changed the way they make these since the first pack of crew socks I bought, or these are not the same style as those. Either way, they're otherwise what I was looking for. Durable soft socks with "padded" soles that, to a point, actually "massage" your feet. Very comfortable. So, unless I find some other ones, still Hanes of course, I will likely buy more of these in the future. However, I WILL NEVER order directly from Hanes.com again. It seems their left hand doesn't know what the right one is doing. First, my package ships and I get an email about it, but NO tracking info. So, I have to contact them about it and, lo and behold, not 2 days later my package arrives. Finally, A MONTH later, they send me tracking info that leads to UPS where it tells me my package has been delivered. And, here's the kicker, after that same months time, they finally took their payment from my checking account. If not for that, I probably would have given 5 stars. As it is, the product is carrying 3 stars now and the service 1.

reviews.title: Fashion Hoodie?
reviews.review_text: I am reviewing the Airwalk Men's & Big Men's Graphic Printed Fleece Hoodie (Flazy) Color Heather Grey Size M. First things first, the size is a little bigger than a medium. So your large body could fit into this sweatshirt if you wanted to. I had not been familiar with the brand and the types of prints prior to this shirt. Airwalk has been around for a few years. According to WikiPedia, it started at JC Penney. My interest was the sweatshirt and how it fits and feels. I think I covered fit in the first paragraph. The shirt itself is really nothing special. It is a blended fabric like so many others sold in Walmart, Target, Dollar General, etc.... That means that this shirt is one you buy because you like the Airwalk brand or you think the print is cool. I think the print is cool. So I like it. Typical sweatshirt, aka: Hoodie. Cool print. Buy it because of the design. Do not think that it is a special sweatshirt or Hoodie variant. This sweatshirt has caused me to think about other Airwalk branded products. I will look into those and see if I can match them with my new hoodie. It is fashionable and drives my child crazy that I know the brand and am wearing this hoodie. She does not think it is cool on me! Look at the photos and decide for yourself.

reviews.title: Quality made but seemed undersized to me
reviews.review_text: I ordered the Airwalk Hooded Sweatshirt in a Men’s size Medium. When it arrived, I was impressed with the way it looked. The problem came when I tried to put it on to see how it looked on me and I was disappointed to find I could barely get my head through the neck opening. The sweatshirt just seemed to be undersized for a Medium. Even my wife, who is much smaller than I am, thought the neck opening was very small, too. Aside from being too small for me, I liked the design features with a small logo in pink on the front, pink “walking people” on both sleeves, a large 9.5x9 inch (predominately pink and black) walking person on the back, and even a pink logo on the top of the hood. I liked the oversized front pocket (14x9 inches) which is large enough to hold gloves, keys, phone, wallet or to keep your hands warm in cold weather. I like how the wrist cuffs and waistband has a nice stretch to them. The fleece lining will definitely keep you warm in cold weather. The half-inch wide drawstring for the hoodie was nice and strong. The workmanship appears to be superb. I liked everything about this hoodie. I just need a size (or two) larger.

reviews.title: Warmpth shirt
reviews.review_text: The sweatshirt has a checker board meets carnival mirror pattern. The material is thin enough to move with you, but thick enough to keep you warm when there's a chill in the air. The drawstrings have heat shrink on the ends of them which are softer and much better than the hard plastic most others use. The tag is a little itchy, but that is easily solved by cutting it out. The hood isn't too heavy feeling which I like because it doesn't feel like it's in the way.

After exercising or if I just have a sore muscle, it does seem to help breal up the lactic acid. I had hoped the head would move more in and out instead of just vibrate. The tips are nice to change the placement or pinpoint an area. It has 2 speeds which the higher speed seems to do more to relieve discomfort. The only other con would be that it didn't come with a small travel bag to put it and all the other tips in. Since it's supposed to be portable, a carry bag or strage bag of some kind would have been nice.

reviews.title: Adequate
reviews.review_text: This Homedics Vibration Massager is just that - vibration massage, not deep tissue massage. It vibrates. It is very lightweight. There are two speeds. Hi and Lo. I never use the lo speed. It is very weak. I use this mostly for a foot massage and for my hands. I have arthritis in my hands and colder temps make my hands ache. I just hold this little vibration massager in each hand several times during the day and that eases the pain most of the time completely. I also use it on my knees. It is a light massage, but any massage helps me. Homedics is a reliable brand.

reviews.title: Weight set is imbalanced.
reviews.review_text: The weight set might be fine for a young, fit person. I am a senior citizen and would like to have seen intermediate weights included, or the top-end weights not as heavy. The included weights are 2.5 lbs and 7.5 lbs. The step up from a 5 lb dumbbell to a 15 lb. dumbbell is too extreme, at least to this old fud. In my opinion either a 5 lb weight should be the highest weight, or a 5 lb weight should be included, for which I would have paid more. If Walmart carries the 5 lb weights I will order them. I did find the weight set to be well-made and the clamps easy to use. I also found that the bars are slightly too short for my hands, so the weights rub on the outside of my knuckles when I am working out.

reviews.title: Get what you pay for...
reviews.review_text: Ok, so technically they will work. Depending on what you're using them for, a few caveats: 1. The bars are hollow, instead of typically being solid. Looks like a big hollow tube is welded on a little hollow tube. Not sure how this will affect durability, though mine haven't broken so far. 1a. The welds are not clean; because of the welds, the plates won't sit flat against the inside collars. 2. The spring clips are junk. If you're using heavy weights, you'll need a screw on or other type of heavy-duty collar. Overall, these will probably work for most aplpications. If you're using heavy weights (which is why i opted for olympic bars), especially with the dumbbells, which tend to take more abuse than the curl bar, you're probably better off getting a higher quality solid set.

reviews.title: curl bar
reviews.review_text: The curl bar is very light and feel flimsy. The dumbell bar are too long. The only good thing is that you could easily switch Olympic plates on and of the curl bar. If you are semi to serious lifter get something else. It's cheap though.

If your wondering if this product will stand up to alot of weight, I'm letting you know that it will for the most part. I use them 5x a week and have had this set for 8 or 9 months and the EZ bar just now broke. One of the welds gave in. To me I got my use out of it and am purchasing another set right now. Although very light weight, I frequently put 100 to 150 lbs of weight on both the EZ bar and dumbell handles and it took this long to break.

reviews.title: I guess you get what you pay for.
reviews.review_text: The product was shipped to store as promised. I am happy with that. But once I looked at the pieces, I was not happy with them. They are very light and do not look to hold up to very much weight at all. I did not test them, so I can't say for sure, but I would hate to be lifting and have one of the ends break off. I guess I should have read more of the reviews before purchasing.

These adjustable weights work fine, I like the design/colors/materials and they're decent for the amount I paid, but the only thing I don't like is that the nuts that hold the plates in place loosen during the workouts. it's not just an inconvenience, it could be dangerous if they fall off during an exercise. I would recommend them but just beware of that issue and be sure to tighten them as much as possible.

reviews.title: BONCAMO Reading Glasses
reviews.review_text: The Mrs likes the way they look and fit reasonably well (not a fit for all). She's going to return them because the strength is incorrect. If you are specifically looking for blue light filtering then keep on looking. She doesn't feel that the blue light filtering is working on these new glasses compared to her prescription glasses with blue light filtering (and a plethora of other amenities). The package did include a soft glasses pouch and a cleaning cloth.

reviews.title: Where are they?
reviews.review_text: Glasses showed up at a facility a few miles away and stayed there for a week. Walmart looked into the delay and said they were told the glasses were lost. Then the order tracking info claimed they were delivered. They weren’t.
Pretty much on the verge of braking and I have only worn them a few times.

reviews.title: Still looking for wide glasses. Break EZ.
reviews.review_text: These glasses are supposed to be for wide heads. They fit my head but they are slightly snug , but wearable. They break easily; either the arms break or the lenses fall out after a crack in the frame. Sometimes I can glue them together. They only last about a couple months during daily frequent off and on use.
Different colors. somewhat substantial for the price.
